comments.body: so the Scala 2 semanticdb implementation matches the old version exactly, whereas here the locals are in the opposite order. (I will look to see if there is a way to avoid reversing the traversal order in `ExtractSemanticDB`)

As you may know, this is because of the change in traversing order. And I think this isn't a big deal for SemanticDB consumers as long as the same (compiler's) symbol has the same (semanticdb's) symbol.
